docsTags.name: virtualProp
docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: - The label text to associate with the radio. Use the "labelPlacement" property to control where the label is placed relative to the radio.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: container - The container for the radio mark.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: mark - The checkmark or dot used to indicate the checked state.

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the radio.

props.name: justify
props.docs:
How to pack the label and radio within a line.
`"start"`: The label and radio will appear on the left in LTR and
on the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label and radio will appear on the right in LTR and
on the left in RTL.
`"space-between"`: The label and radio will appear on opposite
ends of the line with space between the two elements.

props.name: labelPlacement
props.docs:
Where to place the label relative to the radio.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the radio in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the radio in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").

props.name: legacy
props.docs:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt components in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or the default slot that contains
the label text. As a result, the `legacy` property should only be used as
an escape hatch when you want to avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.
Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

events.docs: Emitted when the radio button loses focus.
Emitted when the radio button has focus.

styles.name: --inner-border-radius
styles.docs: Border radius of the inner checked radio

slots.docs: The label text to associate with the radio. Use the "labelPlacement" property to control where the label is placed relative to the radio.

parts.name: container
parts.docs: The container for the radio mark.

parts.name: mark
parts.docs: The checkmark or dot used to indicate the checked state.
